name: hexameter
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a line in poetry that has six feet (= units containing one strong syllable and one or two weaker ones), or the rhythm of poetry that has this pattern: in hexameter In this Ode, Horace extolls in hexameter the virtue of his patron. Elegaic metre is a couplet consisting of one hexameter and one pentameter. Compare
pentameter
tetrameter
More examplesFewer examplesIt turns out that reciting poetry - especially verse like Homer's that follows a specific rhythm called hexameter - makes an excellent breathing exercise.He wrote Nova Anglia, a poem in Latin hexameters.Hexameter is a literary and poetic form consisting of six metrical feet per line as in the Iliad.This was a translation of the Epic of Gilgamesh rendered literally into English hexameters.
